item.title: Offensive graffiti outside our homes., 4th January
item.description:
There has been offensive graffiti directly outside my home for a while now, everyone I open my front door or look out my window that is the first thing I see. It is on the wall on Ayres Street near where the solo bin is and on the other side of the shell garage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Ayres Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely dangerous icy on roads, 4th January
item.description:
The roads around links estate are deadly these mainly include New Street Hill. Many cars have slid and headed to pavements. One car I saw nearly hit a child. Our roads used to be gritted as this estate has many hills and a lot of children living in the area. Please can you reinstate gritting around our area to avoid any casualtys
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawn Close, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Road, Plaistow, Greater London

item.title: Littering next to a public footpath - Along Woolwich Road, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, This is ongoing issue with how dirty Woolwich Road is and a lot of it is due to lack of regular cleaning done by the council. This is really off-putting and there is visible difference in cleaning around Charlton vs towards East / West Greenwich. Please sort this out as this is really disappointing and off-putting. Best, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton

item.title: Woolwich Road hasn't been swept over a month - urgent, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, I've reported the state of Woolwich Road to the council throughout December and nothing was done due to low staff availability but also pretty bad prioritising of the street cleaning. Please ensure this is sorted asap as the road looks pretty much disgusting atm. I don't remember it looking so bad. Thanks, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle path - where painted blue -, 4th January
item.description:
There are 2 blue painted areas on the cycle path - the one at the location I have provided and one before this, further down the hill. Both of these blue patches are very icy. I was cycling here on Friday morning 2nd January 2025 - it was about 1 degree, the tarsealed paths were fine - but as soon as I hit the blue patch my bike just came out from under me. I looked at the paths and the blue areas only are very very slippery. I have been cycling for years and this is not really how a cycle path should be.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rainton Road requires cleaning, 4th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
